Državni svet izglasoval veto na ukinitev dodatka za delovno aktivnost
05 Nov 2019, 17:04 by STA

Državni svet je izglasoval veto na novelo zakona o socialnovarstvenih prejemkih, s katero želi vlada ukiniti dodatek za delovno aktivnost. Za veto je od 28 na glasovanju navzočih svetnikov glasovalo 13, proti so bili trije. Sprejem veta pomeni, da bo moral državni zbor o noveli odločati znova, pri čemer bo za potrditev potrebnih 46 glasov poslancev.



Državna svetnica in predsednica Zveze svobodnih sindikatov Slovenije Lidije Jerkič: “Če res prihaja do zlorab, naj se dodatek vzame tistim, ki ga zlorabljajo, ne pa kar vsem.”  Foto: STA

LJUBLJANA > Sprejem veta so v državnem svetu (DS) predlagali predstavniki interesne skupine delojemalcev. Ti so po besedah državne svetnice in predsednice Zveze svobodnih sindikatov Slovenije Lidije Jerkič prepričani, da spremembe ne vodijo v hitrejšo aktivacijo upravičencev do denarne socialne pomoči, kar zagovarja ministrstvo za delo, temveč v poslabšanje njihovega socialnega in materialnega položaja.
Dodatek namreč v osnovi prejemajo tisti, ki so delovno aktivni in hkrati prejemajo socialno pomoč, ker njihov dohodek ne omogoča preživetja, je opozorila.
“Dodatek naj se vzame tistim, ki ga zlorabljajo, ne pa kar vsem”
Kot je dejala, nasprotuje tudi argumentu ministrstva, da je treba dodatek ukiniti, ker naj bi prihajalo do zlorab. “Če res prihaja do zlorab, naj se dodatek vzame tistim, ki ga zlorabljajo, ne pa kar vsem,” je dejala.
Državni sekretar na ministrstvu za delo Tilen Božič je nasprotno opozoril, da dodatek ne služi več svojemu namenu, ker ne spodbuja več k delovni aktivnosti. Povedal je, da je ministrstvo kot nadomestek za ukinitev dodatka sprejelo vrsto drugih ukrepov za izboljšanje položaja njegovih prejemnikov, med drugim je tudi zvišalo denarno socialno pomoč: “Zato je treba vse skupaj jemati kot paket.”
Razprave svetnikov ni bilo, so pa nekateri pred glasovanjem obrazložili svoj glas. Državni svetnik Franc Kangler je napovedal, da ga Božič s svojimi argumenti ni prepričal, zato da se bo glasovanja vzdržal. Enako je napovedal Marko Zidanšek. “V tej državi smo razvrednotili delo - na eni strani z nedomišljeno socialno politiko, na drugi strani pa z premalo plačanim poštenim delom, zato nas prehitevajo tako po levi kot po desni,” je dejal.
“V državnem svetu zastopam interese obrtnikov in samostojnih poklicev, ki mi pravijo, da ne dobijo delavcev, zato veta ne bom podprl,” je napovedal predsednik DS Alojz Kovšca.
Matjaž Švagan je napovedal, da bo glasoval za. Prepričan je namreč, da lahko država 16 milijonov evrov, kolikor naj bi jih prihranila z ukinitvijo dodatka, prihrani kje drugje.
Novela zakona, ki jo je DZ sprejel minuli teden, predvideva ukinitev dodatka za delovno aktivnost, ki je del denarne socialne pomoči. Takšno rešitev so predlagali na ministrstvu za delo z argumentom, da dodatek nima enakega učinka kot ob uvedbi leta 2012 in ljudi ne spodbuja k zaposlovanju, ampak povzroča neaktivnost v času, ko na trgu primanjkuje delovne sile.
Sprejemanje zakonske novele so do zdaj spremljali glasni pozivi nevladnih organizacij, naj DZ dodatka ne ukine. Predlogu nasprotujejo tudi v Levici in SD ter v sedmih sindikalnih centralah, kjer opozarjajo, da bi ukinitev najbolj prizadela predvsem tiste, ki že zdaj živijo na robu ali pod pragom tveganja revščine.
Državni zbor bo moral odločati znova
Po danes izglasovanem vetu bo moral državni zbor o noveli odločati znova, pri čemer pa je za njeno sprejetje tokrat potrebnih najmanj 46 glasov. Glede na to, da je minuli teden za novelo glasovalo le 34 poslancev, je vnovična potrditev predloga pod vprašajem.

The National Council vetoed the abolition of the employment allowance
05 Nov 2019, 16:04 by STA

The National Council vetoed the amendment to the Social Security Benefits Act, which seeks to abolish the employment allowance for the government. Of the 28, 28 out of 28 voted in favor of the councilors, with three against. The adoption of the veto means that the National Assembly will have to decide again on the amendment, with 46 votes being required to confirm.



State Councilwoman and President of the Union of Free Trade Unions of Slovenia Lidija Jerkič: “If abuse does occur, allowance should be taken to those who abuse it, but not to everyone.” Photo: STA

LJUBLJANA> The adoption of a veto in the National Council (DS) was proposed by representatives of the Employee Stakeholder Group. According to the State Councilwoman and President of the Union of Free Trade Unions of Slovenia, Lidija Jerkič, the changes do not lead to faster activation of beneficiaries of financial social assistance, which the Ministry of Labor advocates, but to the deterioration of their social and material situation.
The allowance is basically received by those who are working and at the same time receiving social assistance because their income does not allow them to survive, she warned.
“The allowance should be taken to those who abuse it, but not to everyone”
She also contradicted the ministry's argument that the allowance should be abolished because abuse was alleged. "If abuse does occur, the allowance should be taken to those who abuse it, but not to everyone," she said.
The State Secretary at the Ministry of Labor, Tilen Božič, on the other hand, warned that the supplement no longer serves its purpose because it no longer encourages work activity. He said the ministry had taken a number of other measures to improve the status of its recipients, as a substitute for the abolition of the supplement, including raising financial social assistance: "Therefore, everything should be taken as a package."
There was no discussion of the saints, but some voted before the vote. National Councilor Franc Kangler announced that he had not been persuaded by Santa's arguments to abstain. The same was announced by Marko Zidanšek. "In this country, we have undervalued work - on the one hand, with reckless social policy, and on the other, with underpaid fair work, so we are overtaking both left and right," he said.
"I represent the interests of craftsmen and independent professions in the national council, who tell me that they do not get workers, so I will not support the veto," announced DS President Alojz Kovšca.
Matjaž Švagan has announced that he will vote in favor. He is convinced that the state can save EUR 16 million in savings by abolishing the allowance elsewhere.
A draft law passed by the National Assembly last week envisages the abolition of a work allowance that is part of financial social assistance. Such a solution was proposed by the Ministry of Labor, arguing that the allowance does not have the same effect as when it was introduced in 2012 and does not encourage people to recruit, but causes inactivity at a time when there is a shortage of labor in the market.
The adoption of the legal amendment has so far been accompanied by loud calls from NGOs not to abolish the parliamentary allowance. The proposal is also opposed in the Left and the SD, as well as in seven trade union centers, which warned that those who already live on the edge or below the at-risk-of-poverty threshold would be most affected by the abolition.
The National Assembly will have to decide again
After the veto passed today, the National Assembly will have to decide again on the amendment, with at least 46 votes required to adopt it. Given that only 34 MPs voted in favor of the amendment last week, the reaffirmation of the proposal is in doubt.
